creator: jay.blanton@sbcglobal.net
text:
I implemented CatalogResolver and successfully tested it on my local system, 
because my local system is exploded and it appears that the Catalog framework 
looks for the catalog files (defined in CatalogManager.properties) on the file 
system and not the classpath. So when these files are built into the 
application ear and pushed to another server (not exploded)...I receive errors 
because the Catalog xml files cannot be found.

It appears that CatalogManager.readProperties correctly retrieves the 
CatalogManager.properties:

CatalogManager.class.getResource("/"+propertyFile);

Which correctly works for jar'd files.

But the CatalogManager then uses the file system to retrieve the Catalog xml 
files in CatalogManager.getCatalogFiles():

absURI = new URL(propertyFileURI, catalogFile);

This is causing my application to fail because the when my ear is deployed, the 
jar files containing my code/properties/xml files, is not exploded to the file 
system.  Therefore it cannot seem to find the Catalog xml files, but does find 
the CatalogManager.properties file.

Sorry if I created this incorrectly with the severity, I am new to this.  But 
if this is an issue, I have to implement a work around immediately.  Any help 
would be appreciated.

Thanks,

-jay

Just additional information.

The CatalogManager.properties file is in one jar and the Catalog xml files are 
in different jars.  All jars are on the classpath.
creator: jay.blanton@sbcglobal.net

text:
If you want the catalog files to appear in the jar files, you must
set the "relative-catalogs" property to "no".

Please let me know if that does not resolve your problem.
